description.compact: Class that represents a system log item

var.description: The name of the database provider to use when querying the database for this item.
The name of the database table where this items are stored.
The name of the field on the table that uniquely identifies this item on the database table with a numeric id. It should be an autoincrement field.
The name of the field on the table that uniquely identifies this item on the database table with a string.
The name of the cache provider to use.
The TTL for the cache storage.
The string to use as the key for this Item in the cache, the value of the idFieldName will be appended.
<queryDatabaseCache|queryDatabase> The method to use when loading this item from the database via id
<queryDatabaseCache|queryDatabase> The method to use when loading this item from the database via string field
Hash array specification of the fields on the database table for this item type, where each key is the field name and the value is a hash array with the following keys:

docblock.var: - type: The type of the field, one of the available \Cherrycake\Modules\DATABASE_FIELD_TYPE_ - title: The title of the field, to be used when representing data on modules like UiComponentTable - prefix: The prefix string to add when humanizing the field value - postfix: The postfix string to add when humanizing the field value - multiplier: A multiplier to apply when humanizing the field value - decimals: The number of decimals to show when humanizing the field value - humanizeMethodName: A method name to call to humanize the field value. It will receive the raw value as the first and only parameter. If this returns something other than null, the returned value will be used and any other humanizing method and configs like prefix, postfix, multiplier, decimals, etc will be omitted. - humanizePreMethodName: A method name to call with the field value before any other humanization is done. It will receive the raw value as the first and only parameter - humanizePostMethodName: A method name to call with the field value after any other humanization is done. It will receive the already treated value as the first parameter and the original raw value as the second

docblock.description: An array of field names that are expected to be timestamps from the Database, in order to be properly converted to unix timestamps when loaded.

var.description: An array containing the Item data

docblock.description:
Constructor, allows to create an instance object which automatically fills itself using one of the available load methods
Setup keys:
* loadMethod: If specified, it loads the Item using the given method, available methods: - fromDatabaseRow: Loads the Item with the given DatabaseRow object data in the setup key "databaseRow" - fromId: Loads the item by calling the loadFromId method passing the value of the "id" setup key as the parameter - fromData: Loads the item by calling the loadFromData method passing the value of the "data" setup key as the parameter

param.description: Specifications on how to create the Item object

docblock.description: Fills the Item's data with the given DatabaseRow object data

return.description: True on success, false on error

docblock.description: Fills the Item's data with the given data array

param.description: A hash array with the data

return.description: True on success, false on error

docblock.description: Loads the item when no loadMethod has been provided on construction. Should be overloaded.

param.description: A hash array with the data

return.description: True on success, false on error

docblock.description: Fills the Item's data from the given id, intended to be overloaded by specific Item subclasses

return.description: True on success, false on failure

docblock.description: Returns a DatabaseRow object containing the query result of the Item with the given id

param.description: The id of the Item to load from the Database

return.description: A DatabaseRow object containing the result of querying the item with the given id, or false if error
The SQL query to request the item of the given id from the Database

docblock.description: Fills the Item's data from the given stringField, intended to be overloaded by specific Item subclasses

return.description: True on success, false on failure

docblock.description: Returns a DatabaseRow object containing the query result of the Item with the given string field

param.description: The string field value of the Item to load from the Database

return.description: A DatabaseRow object containing the result of querying the item with the given id, or false if error
The SQL query to request the item of the given string field from the Database

docblock.description: Removes this Item from the cache. Can be overloaded if more additional things have to be cleared from cache in relation to the Item.

return.description: True on success, false on failure

description.compact: Inserts a row on the database representing and item

param.description: Optional fields data that will override the data stored on the object if specified. Fields must be defined on this->fields

return.description: The newly created Item, or false if any error occurred.

description.compact: Updates the data on the database for this Item

param.description: A hash array of the keys and values to update

return.description: True if everything went ok, false otherwise

description.compact: Deletes the data on the database representing this unique item, as per the current $idFieldName value

return.description: True on success, false on failure

docblock.description: Initializes the Item. Intended to be overloaded to perform any additional actions that must be done just after the Item is loaded with data

return.description: True on success, false on failure

description.compact: Magic get method to return the Item's data corresponding to the specified $key If the key is for a database field that is language dependant as specified by $this->fields, the proper language data according to the current Locale language will be returned If the key is for a timezone dependant field as specified by $this->fields, the proper timezone adjusted timestamp will be returned according to the current Locale timezone

param.description: The key of the data to get

return.description: The data. Null if data with the given key is not set.

comment.value: If key is for a database field

description.compact: Gets the item data for the specificied language when the field is language dependant

param.description: The key of the data to get
The language to get the data for

return.description: The data. Null if data with the given key is not set, or false if the specified key is not for a language dependant field

description.compact: Gets the item data for the specified timezone when the field is timezone dependant

param.description: The key of the data to get
The timezone, as in http://www.php.net/timezones

return.description: The timestamp data. Null if data with the given key is not set, or false if the specified key is not for a timezone dependant field

description.compact: Gets the specified item data in a way that's readable for a human.

docblock.description: Intended to be used by modules like UiComponentTable

param.description: The key of the data to get
Whehter to use HTML to help make the data readable by a human

description.compact: Magic set method to set the data $key to the given $value

param.description: The key of the data to set
The value

description.compact: Magic method to check if the data with the given $key is set

param.description: The key of the data to check
True if the data exists, false otherwise

description.compact: Creates an object and returns it

param.description: A hash array with the select specs
A hash array with the setup keys

description.compact: Bulk sets the given properties for this object

param.description: A hash array of properties
Whether to overwrite properties if already set

description.compact: Provides a system to pass complex parameters to a method, where parameters are passed in a hash array instead of the usual parameters passing method. A method using this system should accept a hash array of parameters and pass them as the first parameter to this method via a parent::treatParameters call, specifying as a second parameter a setup hash array of options for each parameter to be treated in a special way.

param.description: &$parameters The hash array of received parameters
A hash array of setup options on how to treat each passed parameter
